body:
Hello, thank you for your reply. I was using the convert_graph_to_onnx.py code, but was getting the following error: RuntimeError: Exporting the operator as_strided to ONNX opset version 11 is not supported. Please open a bug to request ONNX export support for the missing operator. 
I haven't been able to figure it out
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42269506/87004137-6632f880-c1d6-11ea-8cf0-7ee0ae4cefc3.png)

@Nouman97, can you change the last parameter to be opset=12? If not working, try pytorch nightly package as well.

If the problem still exists, that means as_strided cannot be converted to ONNX right now. Then there are two alternatives:
(1) Raise an issue in https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues, and wait until PyTorch supports as_strided to onnx conversion. I could also help forward this request to the owner of onnx exporter.

(2) Modify your modeling script to replace torch.as_strided by using other torch functions that can be converted to ONNX. This is a walk-around, and need not wait for PyTorch change.

Hello, thanks for following up; I tried changing the opset but the error still persists. It will be difficult to perform (2) because I am importing the entire architecture from huggingface transformers. Instead, I will be raising it as an issue as you mentioned.
Hi @Nouman97 did you get any luck with fixing the runtime error during longformer optimisation on onnx

> Hi @Nouman97 did you get any luck with fixing the runtime error during longformer optimisation on onnx

Unfortunately not. I am still looking for solutions.

This issue has been automatically marked as stale due to inactivity and will be closed in 7 days if no further activity occurs. If further support is needed, please provide an update and/or more details.
For anyone who is interested in Longformer, currently we are working on the optimization. Hopefully, we will have it working in two months.

issue.title: Add Longformer Attention Cuda Op

repository.name: onnxruntime
repository.description: ONNX Runtime: cross-platform, high performance ML inferencing and training accelerator

issue.body:
**Description**: 
Add longformer attention cuda operator. It is based on CUDA kernels provided by Nvidia.

Limitation: Global tokens must be at the beginning of sequence.

**Motivation and Context**
- Why is this change required? What problem does it solve?
- If it fixes an open issue, please link to the issue here.
https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/issues/4449

body: This issue has been automatically marked as stale due to inactivity and will be closed in 7 days if no further activity occurs. If further support is needed, please provide an update and/or more details.

issue.title: Longformer Attention CUDA kernel memory Improvements

repository.name: onnxruntime
repository.description: ONNX Runtime: cross-platform, high performance ML inferencing and training accelerator

issue.body:
**Description**: 
(1) Integrate improvements from NVidia: Reduce memory footprint in CUDA kernel with an additional assumption that max number of global tokens <= attention window size.
(2) Refactor global index calculation to prepare moving it out of longformer attention kernel.
(3) Update ONNX conversion script to support transformers 4.3.0.
(4) Update benchmark script for testing batch_size correctly.

Note:  When there is global token, sometime output has NaN. I will fix it in another PR.

**Motivation and Context**
- Why is this change required? What problem does it solve?
- If it fixes an open issue, please link to the issue here.

It is related to https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/issues/4449
